scenario: Celsius Holdings, the energy drink maker, saw its shares decline 12.9% after a downbeat consumer sentiment report weighed on the stock. The report showed a seven-point drop in the Consumer Confidence Index to 98.3, with expectations down 9.3 points to 72.9, indicating consumers are feeling nervous about inflation and potential tariffs. Celsius is sensitive to consumer spending and faces challenges from PepsiCo's overstocked inventory, as well as new sugar-free competition from Red Bull and Monster Beverage. The company's core business continues to struggle, with revenue and profit declining in its fourth-quarter earnings report. Retail level sales in the U.S. grew just 2%, a far cry from the high-double-digit growth Celsius was experiencing not long ago. The acquisition of Alani Nu, the nation's fourth-largest energy drink brand, may not be enough to turn the company's fortunes around, especially if consumer spending continues to weaken.
